lines.text: Because it is my name! Because I cannot have another in my life! Because I lie and sign myself to lies! Because I am not worth the dust on the feet of them you have hanged! How may I live without my name? I have given you my soul; leave me my name!
Elizabeth, your justice would freeze beer.
Go to bed, Mary.
I'll not be ordered to bed anymore, Mr. Proctor. I am 18 now and a woman... however single.
If you wish to sit up, then sit up.
I wish to go to bed.
Good night, then.
Good night.
Abby, I may think of you softly from time to time, but I will cut off my hand before I reach for you again. We never touched.
Ay, but we did.
I, sir, am innocent to a witch. I know not what a witch is.
If you know not what a witch is, how do you know you are not one?
Purge your contempt and give us the name of the man who accused Putnam. You will say it, Corey.
Speak man, we cannot releant. What say you, Corey?
More... Weight.
Lay on. You are commanded by the court. Lay On!
AAH!
[he dies]
I say- I say- God is dead!
Why did Goody Proctor discharge you from her service?
Because I refused to be her slave.
I have heard said that John Proctor and you...
My name is good in the village! Elizabeth Proctor is an envious, gossipy liar!
To your knowledge, has John Proctor committed the crime of lechery? Answer my question! Is your husband an adulterer?
No sir.
Remove her, Marshal.
Elizabeth, I have confessed it!
Oh, God!
A women comes to my bed every night now and tears out my eyes.
Can you make out who she may be?
I believe she be Reverend John Hale's wife sir.
You must be mistaken my child. The wife of a minister be unlikely...
Satan may reach anyone sir.
Absolutely no one in the world is safe? Is that your meaning?
You are mistaken child. Understand me?
It is not on a boat we'll meet again Abigail, but in hell.
You bring down heaven and raise up a whore!
I want my mama.
Your mama's dead and buried.
I'll find her! Let me fly! Mama! No!
Why are you doing this? I told you, he knows now.
You drank blood Abby. Did you tell him that?
[Abby slaps Betty]
Don't you ever say that again!
You drank a charm to kill John Proctor's wife! You drank a charm to kill Goody Proctor!
[Abby throws Betty on the bed and starts hitting her]

Shut up! All of you. We danced. That is all, and mark this, if anyone breathe a word or the edge of a word about the other things, I will come to you in the black of some terrible night, and I will bring with me a pointy reckoning that will shudder you! And you know I can do it. I saw Indians smash my dear parents' heads on the pillow next to mine. And I have seen some reddish work done at night. And I can make you wish you had never seen the sun go down!
WHORE! How do you call heaven?
She is a whore!
This will not pass. Can you prove this?
I have known her sir! I have known her.
In what time? What place?
In the proper place where my beasts are bedded.
I am but God's finger, John. If he would condemn Elizabeth, she will be condemned.
These are heavy books.
Well, they should be. They're weighted with authority.
If you do not give me his name, I will have you arrested for contempt of court.
This is a hearing. You cannot arrest me for contempt of a hearing.
Let *you* beware, Mr. Danforth. Do you think yourself so mighty the Devil may not turn *your* wits?
Show honor now, show them a stony heart and sink them with it!

For having committed the crime of witchcraft, Rebecca Nurse, George Jacobs, Mary Easty, John Willard, Martha Corey, Elizabeth Howe, John Proctor, Elizabeth Proctor, Mary Sibber, Hannah Bellows, Bridget Bishop and Sarah Osbourne are from this church with all its blessings and every hope of heaven hereby excommunicate.
It needs a cold wife to prompt lechery.
Who weeps for these weeps for corruption.
Mr. Parris, you are a brainless man!
Question Abigail Williams about the gospel, not myself!
Hell and Heaven grapple on our backs, and all our old pretenses ripped away. God's icy wind will blow.
The pure in heart need no lawyers.
Witchin's a hangin' error in Salem, like they done in Boston two year ago!
Do you know your commandments, Mr. Proctor?
Aye.
Would you recite them please?
The commandments?
Aye.
Thou shalt not kill.
Aye.

Thou shalt not steal, thou shalt not covet thy neighbors goods, nor covet thy neighbors wives, thou shalt have no other Gods before me, thou shalt not use the Lord's name in vain, thou shalt keep holy the sabbath day, thou shalt honor thy mother and father, thou shalt not bare to false witness... thou shalt not covet thy neighbors wives.
You said that one twice, Sir.
Aye.
Adultry, John.
Aye. You see, Sir, between the two of us, we do know them all.
A fart on Thomas Putnam!
John Proctor, I've seen your power. You are combined with ANTI-CHRIST!
